text: Kurt Wüthrich (born 4 October 1938) is a Swiss chemist/biophysicist and Nobel Chemistry winner. He is known for developing nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) methods for studying biological macromolecules.Kurt Wuthrich faculty page at ETH Zürich'An Interview with Kurt Wuthrich Freeview video by the Vega Science TrustWuthrich Nobel Prize Lecture Historical Dictionary of Switzerland entry He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:Swiss chemists Category:Swiss physicists Category:Swiss biologists Category:Swiss Nobel Prize winners Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from the canton of Bern Category:Seeland (administrative district)
title: Kurt Wüthrich
